revised_title: An Unusual Lunar Phenomenon Observed by William Wilkins in 1794
tldr: In 1794, William Wilkins observed a fixed, steady light on the dark part of the moon, which he believed to be a star. The light spot appeared brighter than other illuminated parts of the moon and remained visible for several minutes before disappearing. Wilkins sought opinions from other astronomers, including Dr. Nevil Maskelyne, to determine the cause of this unusual phenomenon.
